website_summaries.verdict: While serious runners may find that the S4i Rugged in-ear headphones won't stay in their ears that securely, they're an excellent pair for gym and everyday use.
pros: The Klipsch S4i Rugged in-ear headphones have the same impressive sound and fit as the original S4i model but they're more durable and have a sweat-resistant design
There's an integrated Apple-friendly remote/microphone and they come with a nice, compact carrying case
cons: While the larger remote is easier to operate by feel, it does dangle and knock around a bit when you're running
the inline remote isn't compatible with many Android smartphones

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic with good sound...while they lasted. Worth the buy.
customer_reviews.text: I give it a 4 star because one of the ears lost 90% of its volume output after about 2 years, but while both speaker were functioning properly, the product produced good sound, created a good seal, and were perfect for exercise. The price justifies the short shelf life of a product that had hundreds of hours put into it. Also of note, the control buttons worked....partially...for Android systems. Turns out that there is a button combination I would trigger rarely that would call my last contact when I would fiddle while running. It always made for an awkward quarter mile for everyone involved.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan Swartz

customer_reviews.title: Worked well, but nothing special
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace an earlier version of Klipsch headphones that had lasted me years of use with working out, travel, daily use, etc. These did not stack up to the original pair. The design was similar, but they had problems with noise cancellation as well as the buttons sometimes not working when trying to use siri with the headphones. They're sturdy and the overall physical quality makes it seem as they will last forever, where they ultimately failed though was the tech side of things.
customer_reviews.author: burnham48

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately got a bad pair
customer_reviews.text: The left ear bud died after slightly more than two months. 100% no audio... No crackle, static, nothing... Just dead. Comfortable and sounded great up until that moment. I tried to troubleshoot to see if maybe the cable had broken somewhere, but the left side is just completely silent. Never got them wet, never abused them... They still look new. Very disappointing as these are not cheap.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hinkle

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 4 months. Volume buttons don't work. Microphone didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Sounded great while they lasted (4 months). Only one ear works (barely) unless the base of the cord is at the perfect angle (which makes both earbuds extremely loud for a second). The sound now cuts in and out so much they're unusable. Expensive for such a short lifespan. Also, the start/stop button works on my Pixel 3 but the volume buttons never worked. When trying to field phone calls with these headphones, I couldn't be heard so I'd have to unplug them whenever I got a call. I was hoping to find a long term set of headphones I could keep coming back to but now I'll look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: As offered, matches expectations
customer_reviews.text: This is the tenth set of these I’ve ordered. I treat them roughly so i don’t blame the product for requiring replacement every three months or so. If i could change one thing it would be strengthening the connection of the cable to the jack.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Whitty

customer_reviews.title: Good for sport, bad for enjoyment of music.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because they look like a rugged set of earbuds made by a brand known for sound quality. Only one of those two qualities panned out. Pros: >Rugged and durable indeed >Big remote/buttons make it easy for quick grab and change of volume, track, etc >Decent bass when using app EQ Cons: >Sound quality is marginal at best. Tinny is an understatement. Maybe they need to break in longer? >Remote is heavy. It has its own, noticeable gravitational pull These will do as a set of snowboarding earbuds until they die. My snowboarding earbuds always die. Then I'll get something better.
customer_reviews.author: M. Villanueva

customer_reviews.title: Brutal User
customer_reviews.text: I'm brutal on wired earbuds. I wear them 10 to 12 hours a day in a cube farm while deployed in Afghanistan. I sleep with them 6-8 hours a night to block out the world. Most earbuds last me 4-6 weeks at the most. I have used 4 sets of these ear buds over the past 8 years. You do the math, they last me an average of 18 to 30 months each set. They sound great for the price range, but the durability is the closer for me. I am currently looking for someplace to get them in $50.00 price range I am used too, instead of the discontinued prices people are asking on line.
customer_reviews.author: Mark G.

customer_reviews.title: They sound just like the S4i's did when they were working well
customer_reviews.text: I got a pair of these to replace my water-destroyed pair of S4i's that were a few years old. Because my iPod Touch's power button doesn't work, I wanted something with a remote and volume control. Trying to find a solid pair with those features, and priced under $60 is difficult. So when these came up as a suggestion, priced at $40, I jumped at the chance. They sound just like the S4i's did when they were working well, and that's exactly what I was looking for. They stay in my ears well while walking, especially with the bigger tips. So far, so good. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Karrie

customer_reviews.title: 18 months and one clothes washing later...
customer_reviews.text: Still rocking after 18 months and a LOT of use. Commuting. Travel. (I mean, what dummy gets on a plane without some kind of noise-cancelling ear bud?) AND I just found these in the washing machine after going through the long extra dirty cycle with my travel stuff and they still work! I've owned expensive Shure brand in the past and they fell apart within 12 months and the company had a really poor customer service option (costing way more money than the ear buds were worth). I think these Klipsch are great middle of the road on price and excellent value for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: MelissaBinNYC

customer_reviews.title: Apple controls a little bulky for ear buds but otherwise the best ear buds I have ever heard.
customer_reviews.text: My left channel of my first non rugged S4i died so I decided to purchase the rugged version. Same awesome sound of the S4i but less noise when the wire is touched. Very comfortable only flaw is the apple controls are housed in a big heavy plastic case which I assume is designed to withstand dirt, water, and use with gloves. The apple control is bulky and looks and feels like cheap thin plastic, but the amazing sound, comfort and less wire noise so far overcomes this issue. The sound is better and has fuller sound than the Klipsch X11i. Would buy again especially since you can get a better price than the regular S4i.
customer_reviews.author: Umans333

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good, some bad
customer_reviews.text: Not great for weight-lifting. The cord is too long, which often leads to the plugs getting ripped out of your ears when doing certain exercises. Even worse, the big buttons which lay on your chest always seem to get pushed accidentally by the bar. Very distracting. There should be an override to shut those buttons off. The sound quality is good to very good, but not great. The old Ultimate Ears I had years ago were the best. Nothing seems to match those, including newer Ultimate Ears. But I do like the earbuds themselves. They conform well to the ear canal, and stay in place with a good seal and stay clean.
customer_reviews.author: edit6

customer_reviews.title: Rugged is right
customer_reviews.text: I had the original black version of this headphone, and after over a year of heavy use the wire broke. I use my original set >4 hours a day, 5 days a week, in sun, rain, snow etc. Often snagging on bushes, fences, gates... so its not surprising that they broke. The large buttons are great, providing me with control even when I wear gloves. I only wish there was a detachable portion of the cable below the controller to safely snap off when I snag it on anything. And I'd prefer a 90 degree connector instead of a straight connector. None the less, I totally recommend this headphone for use when you're exposed to the elements.
customer_reviews.author: H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased numerous in ear headphones over the years and by far these are the best ones I own. As a matter of fact I bought a 2 more pair after trying these (1 for my wife and a spare for me). I have used bose, sennheiser, beats, b&o and some other very inexpensive ones. The only reason I didn't give these 5 stars is because I have never purchased a very expensive set to compare these with. Therefore I'm giving myself some room in the event that I do purchase an expensive set. I use these with my iphone and ipad and the bongiovi dps app. Excellent overall sound.
customer_reviews.author: I.N. Botnick

customer_reviews.title: One of our favorite purchases.
customer_reviews.text: I got these headphones as a gift for my spouse. He uses them all the time at his job and he says that he can easily switch between music and phone calls as well as easily selecting different songs and volume. I have to say as someone who has spoken to him while he is using these headphones, the calls are always crisp and easy to listen to. I never hear background noise or conversations so they are top notch at noise reduction. He loves these headphones and he is very active so they have held up to a lot of abuse and they still look, sound and work phenomenally. It was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: K. Brunton

customer_reviews.title: Durable headphones with great audio.
customer_reviews.text: I wear headphones everyday and I tend to break headphone fairly easily because of the consistent use. These finally broke down on me after a year and a half. I really enjoyed the sound I got but others found them to not have enough bass. A great buy if you can find them under $50 like I did. Comfort depends on the earbud used and what you're doing. If you lean on them they get really uncomfortable and the noise reducing earbuds are to be used in moderation.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Hutchinson

customer_reviews.title: at first they were great. flexible not tangled
customer_reviews.text: at first they were great. flexible not tangled. great sound. after six months one side didn't work. bought it 3 times thinking it was me. happened to husband as well. and with extra care from my part. make them more durable!!
customer_reviews.author: Eri

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound and Sturdy Enough to Last
customer_reviews.text: Had these a few weeks now and use them almost daily. They sound great and are rugged enough that I am pretty sure they will outlast most others I have gone through. They fit snuggly in my ears - never feel like they will fall out - and the weight of the controls isn't as issue as I tuck them through sleeves or bra straps and let my clothing take any weight that may pull them out. I have a set of Bose ear buds and they have slightly better sound but these are definitely up there close. This was a great deal - I have paid more for much less.
customer_reviews.author: BritGal

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I am a runner and a traveler. These in-ears provide excellent sound and convenience for both. The buds fit snugly, yet they don't irritate my ears after a few hours like some others have. These aren't going to give you a lot of bass, but what in-ear really does? The fit and sound block airplane noise extremely well and the large buttons make it easy to make adjustments. The only negative is that those same large buttons make for a heavy and sometimes awkward weight hanging from your ears. The included clip does help, but it's tough to get it just right. In any case, I'd buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: The KGB

customer_reviews.title: good level of base considering the size of the headphones
customer_reviews.text: First the positive, the sound and microphone work very well, good level of base considering the size of the headphones. Now for the negative, the microphone and volume control is too bulky to be used in any activity even walking it tends to weigh down the headphones too much. The clip to secure the cord comes easily off the cord in a few strides which again makes the headphones more cumbersome because of the bulky volume control. On my galaxy s5 the volume control did not work, the play/pause button worked though. They are great headphones but not for exercising of any kind, best for casual listening.
customer_reviews.author: WanderingRC

customer_reviews.title: Beats the heck outa Apple's uncomfortable giveaway headphones. Get Comply 500 Plush tips for best comfort.
customer_reviews.text: Okay 4 casual listening. I prefer their 425s and 535s for great sonic experience. Too bad the higher end Shures have no iPhone/laptop volume controls. Reaching for the laptop to reduce the TV show theme songs is a pain. Be shure (sic) to replace the hot, uncomfortable silicone with Comply Plush 500s for better sound isolation and even the ability to sleep to your favorite Audible narrators voice and soothing music playlists!
customer_reviews.author: G E B

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time buy skullcandy's instead.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to buy a nice earbuds from a good audio brand as my skullcandys broke. I am highly disappointed. All the reviews below are true: Ear buds do not stay in ear. Remote is huge and pulls out the earbuds when working out. I did not like the sound quality because there is next to nothing for bass. I used these for one day and now i am returning them. Not happy I have pay the $6 for shipping. I now understand why I like buying electronics from a local retail store. I am going to get another pair of Skullcandy Method earbuds as these were MUCH better and $20 cheaper! Step up your game Klipsch.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: They sound great UNTIL they die
customer_reviews.text: They sound great but seem to be pretty fragile, I have had 2 sets of these and Both have died. They were the best sounding ear buds by far that I have used but at $60 ish a shot , it is disappointing for both sets to have quit
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.
customer_reviews.text: Headphones are great, good quality. I had two problems with them though. The 'remote' with the controls is giant, with big buttons that get in the way and easily accidentally activate when I wear the cord under my shirt. Also the buds and inserts are comfortable, but I have trouble keeping them in my ears. the plastic they are made out of is too stiff to make a good seal around the rim of my ear - way better then stock iphone headphones, but not as good as earbuds I've had in the past.
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: Good headphones, quality build
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are great, I use them mainly for working out. They fit snug in my ear and dont slip out when i am exercising. The material is water resistant and i Have not had any problems with the wire tangling in my pocket or as I work out. The sound quality is okay (3/5), the bases are low but the sound is clear. These headphones are good (sound quality wise) for the price, but true audiophiles would be wiser to look elsewhere. I would recommend these to the average user who needs headphones to exercise to for casual use. 8/10 - would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: acash0902

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: As always, Klipsche has amazing quality and sound. I bought this headset in the standard "non-rugged" model and tore it up while snowboarding. I'm very excited to get these (on sale even!!!). I haven't had a chance to go snowboarding yet, but can tell they are definitely more rugged and the large buttons will be great when I have gloves on. And of course the sound is amazing My only gripe is the color is not true to the picture. My set is closer to a burnt orange. Don't get me wrong, it's a nice color. But the pictures make it look like almost neon Orange.
customer_reviews.author: BTR

customer_reviews.title: Not rugged
customer_reviews.text: These are described as rugged headphones, but the mic failed for me after just a few months of use. I did use them pretty heavily while working out, so they were often covered with sweat. But, if you're looking for a durable pair of headphones these aren't it. +They sound fine. -Cord gets tangled very easily. This gets worse as the headphones get older. -Earbuds fall off very easily. -Mic failed for me after a few months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I have tried an enormous variety of in-ear head phones for both running and biking. This includes iPod, Skull Candy (various brands), Beats, and Bose. For the money these are far and away the best buds I have used. The volume control and start/stop function does not always work but it doesn't work consistently with any of the brands. The phone microphone does work well and this function has set this brand apart from the others. I would strongly recommend this brand to any athlete.
customer_reviews.author: Bill John

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and Truely Rugged
customer_reviews.text: I remain convinced that theses S4i in-ear buds are the best you can buy for the money. Klipsch included enough different sized ear plugs to accommodate everybody. The oversized controller makes controlling my iPhone very easy, even when I am working out and store my phone in the pocket of my shorts. Also, the super flexible cord resists twisting. Last, and best of all, the sound is just terrific. If you like your white, inexpensive Apple iPhone ear buds, you will be crazy impressed when you listen through the S4i. The difference is like the difference between night and day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the remote is easy to use and my voice sounds crystal clear to ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because of the "directional mic" which is apparently at the top of the yoke of the remote cable, pointing towards your face. It is supposed to help reduce background noise heard by the person you are calling, according to the product description. I can tell you this does not work. Background noise can be heard and doesn't seen muted at all. The pros include the fit in your ears, the remote is easy to use and my voice sounds crystal clear to others (only when there is no background noise).
customer_reviews.author: Ari S

customer_reviews.title: Beware- it is for iphone
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed. If you look at the Amazon posting- it does not say the headset is for Iphones. I have a Samsung SIII and the phones work fine for music, but I cannot hear any conversation through my phone. I then looked at the package and noticed it said for iphone/ ipad. When I ordered, I was not given an option of iphone or android. I would send them back, except that I needed something for a trip on Tuesday. Sound for the music on my galaxy is good, sound for a telephone call is non-existant. Also because of this the buttons don't work. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: skydive

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality for me as radio/music listener, not great for phone conversations
customer_reviews.text: I wear these every day, so I know they will probably not last too long. They seem to have good sound quality for me as a music and radio listener. However, sometimes when I am using them for phone conversations, the person I am speaking to says there's a lot of static. I can't hear it, but I assume they are telling me the truth. I would like to find headphones that are good sound quality for phone conversations as well as for listening to music.
customer_reviews.author: bshound

customer_reviews.title: Klipsch will not honor their warranty.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these headphones after having another set of S4i without issue for nearly 2 years. The sound went out of one ear within two months. I contacted Klipsch to honor their 2 year warranty, after 3 weeks without contact from Klipsch, I called and they said they would send me a different non-rugged, non all weather model (they no longer make these) and only warranty the new headphones for a year. This was very disappointing and so buyer beware, a big part of my motivation to purchase these was the warranty, the next biggest part was "rugged" these are used on a farm and are put through all weather conditions.
customer_reviews.author: KyBooks

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, not great for active sports...
customer_reviews.text: I got these because they were cheap for running but I found the over-sized buttons to be annoying especially as they banged off my chest. I played around using the clip to hold them in different spots but no matter what I did these just didn't cut it for me. I opted to return them and replaced them with bluetooth headphones. I got the Jaybird Bluebuds X and couldn't be happier. Only reason I gave these 2 stars instead of 1 is they still sounded great.
customer_reviews.author: FromMyMellin

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Got them as a gift last year for my boyfriend who wears them all day in an auto body shop. They worked well for about 2 months then the volume buttons stopped working. about 2 months after that one of the ear buds stopped working. He IS really hard on his headphones but for the money, I thought these would have lasted longer than 5 months. especially since they are supposed to be "rugged"
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie c

customer_reviews.title: Best Headphones I've had...I like this brand.
customer_reviews.text: These Klipsch headphones are by far the best headphones I've ever had. The sound quality is superior to the expensive Bose headphones that I paid hundreds of dollars for (I was not impressed with them, they didn't fit my ear correctly). The shape of the earbud fits snugly in my ear and does a fantastic job of cancelling out outside noise while channeling deep base and crisp notes in my ear. I would definitely buy these again and recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Soto

customer_reviews.title: I like the oversized control because it's easy to used
customer_reviews.text: I use these a lot, both in walking around town and running. I like the oversized control because it's easy to used. I do have to use the provided clip and attach the wire to my shirt, otherwise the weight of the control swinging will eventually pull the ear buds out. I've found I like the clip though, because it makes it less likely for me to get caught on something and I can easly take out the buds if I need to talk to someone.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Hinton

customer_reviews.title: the sound is poor vs the sony mdrxb60
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting more about this set of headphonnes, they dont work for Gs4 they dont work for android... the sound is poor vs the sony mdrxb60. The bass is poor,the sounds are no to vivid, i didnt buy this product again if I can have a refund I will like that.. thanks . The only good thing is the mic and the anwer button, and the color. They have a normal development for run, nothing great, just normal.
customer_reviews.author: runner82

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good...
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several pairs of the Klipsch Image S4i headphones, all of which end in one side losing sound (some after a few months, some after a few days!). I was very heartbroken over these losses, as this product really is a good one. Excellent sound quality, stays in place (if you choose the right size for your ear). So I purchased the "rugged, waterproof" version, in hopes that this pair would outlast the others. So far, everything is normal - same quality, same sound. I like the big buttons, makes it easier to press when running. I've only had them for about a month, so we'll see how far they get me.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, good sounding headphones that stand up to my abuse.
customer_reviews.text: I like these. They are sturdy and standup to the wear and tear I subject them to. The sound quality (at least to my ears) is very good and they block out the background noise nicely on airplanes and trains. The one thing I didn't like is the plastic ear pieces. They're uncomfortable for long trips. I replaced them with some foam tips and they work very nicely. I do not own an iPhone so the volume controls do not work with my phone but the microphone does so these are pretty good for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Headphones that won't fall out - ever!
customer_reviews.text: These are so durable, sound proof, and comfortable. I have a tragus piercing in my ear, making it difficult to wear most earbuds, but these are awesome. Even when I'm doing something super vigrous or running long distance they stay in. If I'm bouncing around a lot, also, I can switch which ear they are in and get an even tighter fit. The sound quality is also really great.
customer_reviews.author: dahanese

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound, Not Rugged
customer_reviews.text: I've had about four pair of these, including warranty replacements, and I have to say I'm done. The sound quality is excellent, and I find them extremely comfortable to wear during workouts. However, the control buttons stop working for each and every pair I've acquired after about a year of use. They've not been subjected to any kind of misuse -- no going through the laundry or the like. The buttons just stop functioning. I'm extremely disappointed -- I'll give them two stars for the very good sound quality, but at the cost (even deeply discounted), they should work for more than one year.
customer_reviews.author: Dale R. Gardner

customer_reviews.title: good not great
customer_reviews.text: Yes you can operate the controller with gloves on which is why I bought them...and for that they are probably the best thing available, but for the price I was not impressed with the sound or noise blocking. Yes, if you jog with them..the weight of the volume controller pulls the earbuds out of your ears if you don't secure it to your shirt somehow
customer_reviews.author: sylvan rocks climbing

customer_reviews.title: Works great with the iPhone
customer_reviews.text: I really like these earbuds. The volume did not work with my android phone. However it works great with my iPhone 6 Plus. I seem to recall reading that these were not compatible with that phone, but they work great for me. They sound very good and I like how they isolate your ear from outside noise. My only complaint is the clip that holds the big giant controller keeps falling off. I'm working through that...
customer_reviews.author: ILoveMyTivo

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Bought these after my Apple headphones broke within a month of using them. These headphones have lasted well, and still work fine after over a year of use. Great sound quality for the price (though base is a little lacking). I also like the fact that the earbuds block out a lot of background noise. My only complaint is that the buttons are large and clumsy.
customer_reviews.author: karen

customer_reviews.title: I really enjoy these headphones
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy these headphones. Audio is amazing and they feel very robust and durable. one downside is the case they come in that could have been a little bigger. the current one requires you to focus on packing them away which isnt ideal if you really just need to throw them in the case and dip. I had the senheiser cx60i which sucked because the little earbud plastics would fall out constantly and just general shoddy construction
customer_reviews.author: Gear Crusher

customer_reviews.title: enh...they're ok
customer_reviews.text: So I recently lost my klipsch 4m and needed something to replace em.honestly what sold me was the color but when I got them,I was almost immediately turned off.the biggest thing for me was that the sound quality was way off from my originals. By no means are they horrible but they weren't up to my taste compared to the 4m. The other gripe I had was the thin spaghetti string cord, it just didn't feel rugged by any means and I was just more accustomed to my thick linguine cord.
customer_reviews.author: Big Papa Snuggles

customer_reviews.title: I am quite disappointed with the product- No response from the seller!
customer_reviews.text: I am quite disappointed with the product. Am not sure why the company, as reputed as Klipsch, would continue to advertise this as an outdoor/sports earphones when it keeps falling off from the ear lobes even at the slightest of movement. I tried changing the ear bud tips, which came with the product, but it just won't stick in. This is not the only problem with this earphones- the volume control bar hangs almost close to the belly, which makes the mic almost ineffective in an outdoor setting. Every time I want to use the mic, I have to pull the cord all the way up. I wish, I never had bought these earphones.
customer_reviews.author: Zen

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound!
customer_reviews.text: I was using ear bids provided with my iPod. I was happy with those and had seen reviews for these that made me order them on a whim. These are far superior. They came with a variety of ear channel pieces to allow you to fit them to your own ear size. Not sure why some people have a hard time making them fit. But the sound is magnificent. Go ahead splurge. You'll be happy you did.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W. Neighorn

customer_reviews.title: they are comfortable. Remember that they are noise cancelling which I ...
customer_reviews.text: Once you get the hang of the proper fitting in your ear along with the correct size plugs, they are comfortable. Remember that they are noise cancelling which I like in the gym. Although you cannot answer calls- I would not want to while working out, I appreciate the oversized buttons for the volume control. Overall , these are excellent sport earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: wendya4

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair I have owned. The first lasted four years under constant wear and tear. I strongly stand by this model. The sound quality is on par with Bose/B&O/Sony.
customer_reviews.author: Doesn't matter

customer_reviews.title: They're OK.
customer_reviews.text: Got them for $40 and really don't like them. The fit isn't good. The earpieces are awkwardly slanted backwards, causing them to fall out very easily. The cable is too long, something I never thought I'd complain about. They're good to run through a jacket for skiing but are terrible if you want to do yard work wearing them. They get caught on everything and fall out too easily.
customer_reviews.author: BillTBoston

customer_reviews.title: Klipsch makes really great headphones but I found these to be disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Klipsch makes really great headphones but I found these to be disappointing. The ear tips come off easier than others and the sound is nowhere near as good as other Klipsch products I have purchased. Not pleased considering what I paid for them and they were replaced with a far superior set purchased on amazon for $30.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Jarboe

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great and with interchangable ear buds
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great and with interchangable ear buds, you're going to get a good fit and he right sound. Only draw backs are: 1.) there's no mic for phone calls and 2.) the buttons are so big on the changer that you will constantly be pressing them accidentally if you use them at the gym. Other than that I'm really happy with the quality and the sound.
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: They have excellent sound so I gave them one star
customer_reviews.text: These "Rugged", "All Weather" ear buds are supposed to handle running in rainy weather... I work out on a treadmill but the perspiration caused the In-Line controls to stop working after only a couple of weeks. They have excellent sound so I gave them one star. They are being returned on Monday.
customer_reviews.author: BigBird

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and my 1st in ear canal and surprised ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to ear bud. Great sound and my 1st in ear canal and surprised at the comfort and amazed at the noise reduction it creates. I really like the fact that these a water/sweat resistant. Great for outdoors use with the phone/ipod answer & vol control in line. Absolutely wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES SUMMER

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect...
customer_reviews.text: Waterproof? Yes. Easy to use? Yes. I use these regularly while cycling, hiking, whatever I want. The sound quality is pretty good... I wouldn't rate them as audiophile level but they are better than most. Only down side, the inline button fob is very heavy and pulls down on earbuds while in use. I lost the clip awhile ago, which makes using these a little cumbersome given the weight of the fob.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: The sound is good but not really much better then any other 30 ...
customer_reviews.text: Mine broke after about 4 months of regular usage. The sound is good but not really much better then any other 30 dollar pair of headphones I've owned. I also found the Over sized buttons to be cool at first it but they quickly became quite annoying, as the unit is so heavy it would tug on my headphones and keep them from staying in.
customer_reviews.author: haswell

customer_reviews.title: provide stellar isolation and a good range. As someone who listened to etymotic er ...
customer_reviews.text: I am known as the earbud killer, the destroyer of worlds. I purchased the Image s4i rugged edition upon previously purchasing the non rugged edition and the aforementioned product died underneath my tremendous grasp. These headphones are rugged, provide stellar isolation and a good range. As someone who listened to etymotic er 6is for several years I say the range of the image s4is are comparable. I endorse this product whole heartedly and without regret. I have had them for nearly 6 months and they have not faltered meaning they have not broken even when I stuff them in my pocket or pull on them by accident.
customer_reviews.author: Max Jackson

customer_reviews.title: The apex for quality vs price vs sound
customer_reviews.text: Works great, i seat a lot and I've had the non rugged version and it stood the tests of time. I actually just ran it through the washer, then the dryer by accident, and it's still works PERFECTLY.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Leal

customer_reviews.title: Gift to Granddaughter
customer_reviews.text: My great daughter love ii ... and understands what the plus and minus signs do. She thinks I'm a very electronic savy Grandpa, and I got a smoch. I have no clue whether the product is any good, but I got the reaaction from my grand daughter that I was hoping for. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Stigall

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound quality and very comfortable fit in my ears. It comes with extra ear tips and a cord clip that secures the cord to your shirt while wearing the ear phones. Works perfectly with my Sandisk mp3 player. Other reviewers have complained about the cord length, but I find it to be perfect, allowing me to secure the player in any pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Jack L.

customer_reviews.title: Not Rugged at All - Broke Before Warranty But Klipsch wouldn't honor it
customer_reviews.text: I bought two sets of these headphones and both broke after about two years. Same issue each time: one of the channels started fading in and out then stopped working altogether. They are definitely not "rugged" as advertised. The second pair broke under the two year warranty but because I didn't buy them through an "authorized dealer," even though I bought them Amazon, Klipsch wouldn't honor the warranty. These are much better -
customer_reviews.author: Zachery Kouwe

customer_reviews.title: Great sport headphones with a big inline remote.
customer_reviews.text: These work well for working out, and the water resistance is quite nice. The only real complaint that I have (and why they aren't five stars) is the remote happens to be freaking huge compared to every other pair of headphones that I have used. Some people may like the larger inline controls vs the smaller ones found on other sport oriented headphones, but I just do not care for it. That considered, they are great for what they're intended for while still maintaining quality sound from an earbud.
customer_reviews.author: Stormin

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: Klipsch has long been known for making excellent speakers but their in ear headphones are a well kept secret. They are fantastic, well made, convenient remote that works with ipod as well as my sony xperia z cell phone, and sound that is just amazing. These are every bit as good as the S5i which are 3 times the price right now....the price on these make them an even sweeter deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect worlout earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Great workout earbuds! The sound isn't quite as good as the non rugged version but muuuuch better for exercising. The controller is easily accessible and works very well. In the middle of intense exercise the controller is the easiest one to use of any I have tried. With the great price, i actually purchased 2.
customer_reviews.author: FreddyG

customer_reviews.title: great for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones to use when I workout. Like another reviewer, I, too, had difficulty with them falling out of my ears. I then tried something new and revolutionary: I read the directions. Crazy, right! Well, apparently I was not inserting them into my ears at the correct angle, and now, voila! they stay in. The biggest downside is the size of the controller. The size of this thing makes me feel like I would be entitled to free admittance at a Flavor Flav gathering. Yep, it's huge. Overall, good bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: Chris L.

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I've had a number of Klipsch headphones, even the very expensive, but very nice X10i. They all suffer from not being rugged enough for everyday normal use. I am a profession who wears a suit and exists in a tame environment. But it is amazing the number of things that can grab a cord and ruin a pair of headphones. I've caught them in zippers, folding chairs and door handles. Even exuberant dogs have ripped them out of my ears and sometimes pulling the cords apart. The quality of the S4i clearly isn't like the X10i, but they are good enough and the cords are stronger!
customer_reviews.author: M. Robert Carr

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Great Headphones! Klipsch make some of the best headphones and these were no different. I used them for runs and working out and also walking to class. They sound great and have awesome range. the buttons all work perfectly and have lasted a long time. Some of my favorite headphones i have ever had, especially when it comes to working out. When (if ever) my current pair break, i will def buy them again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love the Klipsh S4i non rugged ear phones
customer_reviews.text: I love the Klipsh S4i non rugged ear phones. I used them for years as my workout phones. Until I got these. They sound just as good, the controls are obviously larger and easier to manage while on the move, and the most important point is the cord is 6-12 inches longer than the regular S4i. Win.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: The sound is fine but the microphone cuts in and out
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited when I got these. The sound is fine but the microphone cuts in and out. I really needed something comfortable for conference calls. These failed immediately. I'll still use them for listening to music while working but these aren't what I wanted or expected for the price.
customer_reviews.author: mg

customer_reviews.title: Clear sound with a few exceptions
customer_reviews.text: The Klipsh earbuds provide clear sound and have been a great way to listen to music at the gym. I find putting the cords over the back of my ears on the way down to the CD player helps to keep the earbuds from moving or falling out as I move. I also put the small, black, plastic plus/minus piece under my sports bra strap. Occasionally as it moves one of the earbuds will go quiet but it does not happen frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Rochelle45

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, not quite what we wanted.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my husband. He had a different pair of Kilpsch earbuds that he lost. Bought this because it was apart of Amazons lightning deals. He said they are okay, sound quality is good but not comparable to the other ones he liked. Returned these so I can get him the other kind.
customer_reviews.author: L.Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy!
customer_reviews.text: I abuse these so much. They continue to hold up and have great quality! I recommend buying extra plastic ear bud caps. I sometimes loose mine as they pop off going in and out of pockets. Great quality and great headset too. Phone Calls work great with these!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: KlipschS4i Black, awesome for my iPad/iPhone use
customer_reviews.text: KlipschS4i Black is awesome it fits perfectly in my ears and they are very comfortable. I use it to watch movies on my iPad mostly. Awesome sound quality, great material. Very happy with this and I highly recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Ali Saadat

customer_reviews.title: klipsch image s4i
customer_reviews.text: I love all things Klipsch but these disappoint. Look great but flimsy and mine were received damaged ( sound in one earpiece was uneven ). They look better in the picture- way better. I will still purchase klipsch products because of all my good experiences and chalk this one up to a fluke that i had high hopes for.
customer_reviews.author: ric

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two pair of these as spare sets for my husband and myself when they were offered on the Amazon Deal of the Day because the sound quality on Klipsch products are so great. My ears are very sensitive to sound. The sound quality of Klipsch earbuds is quite pure, they don't make my ears ache and they have a comfortable fit.
customer_reviews.author: ILuvGoldDogs

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound , BUT
customer_reviews.text: useless for running or biking, because the volume control and speaking box is seriously too big and heavy. It will pull out the earplugs over and over again and while you try to fix that issue, dangle around your head. I ll keep them for travels and use them for non-sport since they look cool and sound amazing (they are Klipsch after all).
customer_reviews.author: franz schmidpeter

customer_reviews.title: bad for running, good for sunbathe
customer_reviews.text: I am an audiophile and I bought them only for running. They replace the previous sennheiser that have ceased to operate. Unfortunately, they are not suitable for the purpose. Despite trying to place them with care (see instructions for using the proper tips and pass the cable behind the ear) headphones are unstable and tend to fall. After choosing the right tip for you, it's not easy to find the best position in the ear canal, anyway the headphones tend to slip in few seconds.The sound is good, with a rather open and detailed sound. Therefore useful for walking or outdoor grill, but if you want to use for running fix them with the glue.
customer_reviews.author: mario vai

customer_reviews.title: Ok sound quality, my issue with these headphones is ...
customer_reviews.text: Ok sound quality, my issue with these headphones is they are advertised as headphones you could use to jog or go to the gym or what not. However, If you plan on moving around even the slightest bit these headphones pop out of your ear. I have tried switching ear bud sizes to no avail. Would bump up the star rating if they would simply stay put.
customer_reviews.author: Spraca

customer_reviews.title: Pooey...
customer_reviews.text: Kinda of cheesey for Klipsch. The cables are very very thin and the control is super huge. The sound quality is horrible compare to the Bose I just bought. As a electronic engineer I was so disappointed in Klipschs lack of good engineering on this product. I know it these wont hold up very long.
customer_reviews.author: jeanne

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: My 2nd pair. Bought them again after my first ones broke after a few years. Love using these on airplanes, because the passive noise cancellation (i.e. earplugs) works great. Great price-performance value. The volume buttons stopped working, and they're still in warranty, but I haven't returned them because I don't want to be without them. I probably should suck it up, and return them for a new pair.
customer_reviews.author: Dan A

customer_reviews.title: Klipsch Image S41 Rugged
customer_reviews.text: These are my first earbud headphones (not counting the iPhone headsets). These are very good headphones. To achieve maximum bass and outside noise reduction, you will have to insert it as far into your ear canal as possible. Test the different ear buds that came with it for the perfect and most comfortable fit. Sound is very clean.
customer_reviews.author: R. Abaya

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I initially liked these headphones. They sounded great, I loved the iPhone integration and look and feel. I purchased them from Amazon on June 10th. They quit working today after daily use during exercise sessions. I was hoping these would last longer than 2 months. I am disapointed and will not purchase another pair!
customer_reviews.author: Jantonice

customer_reviews.title: Not worth buying
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing rugged about these.. they are no better or worse than $10 Wal-Mart earbuds. I with in a factory where it is incredibly hot, I bought these because they are "water resistant". About 15 minutes of seating cause these to go on the Fritz by changing the volume all the way up our all the way down randomly and the headphone jack is very easily sorted out by simply crunching with it plugged into my phone with my phone in my front pocket. Save your money..
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Harris

customer_reviews.title: Second pair I love em, except I sweat a lot when at ...
customer_reviews.text: Second pair I love em, except I sweat a lot when at the gym and the earbuds tend to fall out even when the three button control is clipped to my shirt, actually pretty annoying but for the price, the sound they put out, they're toughness and the call quality when using the speaker control, great deal.
customer_reviews.author: luis a vazquez

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, just read the directions on how to wear them!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sound. If you read the directions and wear these around the ear the way the directions say they stay put and provide EXCELLENT sound. I will say that I have to angle them in just right, but once they are positioned right they are the best pair I've purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Libsterama

customer_reviews.title: Great fit & Great sound
customer_reviews.text: the oval ear buds are very comfortable and the excellent sound quality is just what you expect from Klipsch. Great range and strong, though not over powering, bass, The controller is a larger than I am used to and larger than I like. A little too obvious and inadvertent bumps of the connect/disconnect arrow while doing everyday things has hung up calls. Overall - very pleased !
customer_reviews.author: Phillip M Englert

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: I own the blue version of theses headphones and recently added the red to my collection. I love to bike and run and have to sat these headphones are an amazing value. I consider myself an audiophile and am very particular about these things. Please do not buy the overpriced beats headphones that will break in a month. These headpones are great and work awesome with my iphone 4s when taking calls. You need to wrap them round you ear as suggested when running so they don't fall out. Noise islotation is great. Sound quality is good. Big buttons a plus. Can't go wrong for such a discounted price.
customer_reviews.author: A. D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace a pair of Shure headphones that had developed a short in them after a few years of use. One of the problems I had with the other headphones was when using them while working around the house they would not stay in my ears. Well with these headphones after experimenting with the earpieces I found ones that worked perfectly. The bass response is very good and the ipod controls work well. Plus I was able to find these through Amazon at a great price. I am thinking of getting a pair for my son.
customer_reviews.author: T. J. Hackley

customer_reviews.title: Great sound. Be sure to use the correct size ...
customer_reviews.text: Great sound. Be sure to use the correct size tips for your ears. If you do not, these In-Ear Headphones will sound absolutely awful. I actually initiated a return to Amazon for this item. Before taking them to UPS I decided to check the reviews where I found info on the correct sizing procedure. The difference in sound quality was like night and day.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Bartholomew

customer_reviews.title: One of the best earphones I have used
customer_reviews.text: I use it with my android phone even though it is made for iPhone. Brilliant Bass, good clarity, noise reduction. This is sold in India at approximately INR 6000, whereas in the U.S. you can get it at around $50(approx 3000 INR). If your colleague/friend is returning from the US, and you're looking for an awesome earphones, you can end your search here. It has a mic as well which works with android phones. Play/Pause control works with Android phones. But volume control doesn't work. So is the Next/Previous Song. But still the earphone deserves 5*.
customer_reviews.author: Raviprasad

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasts
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice and gives impression of a durable item - which it is not. Put 'em on a few dosen times, really liked the sound isolation. But then the left earpice "muffled" - lowfreq (bass) is gone and high freq sounds are trembling and screeching. Something with the sound emitter I guess. Only used them rarely at workplace - lasted about 6 months, so no return available. Sigh. Went back to wearing my- it got worse earplugs but still runs good, nearly 2 years of everyday use. I never should have cheated on Logitech. Let this be a lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Victor (somewhere in Russia)

customer_reviews.title: I like the headsets for the sound and noise blocking
customer_reviews.text: I like the headsets for the sound and noise blocking, but have had comments of a lot of scratching noise when I'm talking while moving around. The microphone is in the black volume control with the + / - / Play buttons. It controlled my iPhone just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Parker Pen

customer_reviews.title: NOT Klipsch quality!
customer_reviews.text: These suck! These have to be manufactured by some company other than klipsch. They are rugged, but the sound quality is horrible. There is zero bass. The in-line control is also way to bulky. Go get a cheap pair of skullcandy ear buds.
customer_reviews.author: Hagelicious

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: sound and fit were good, but left ear suddenly stopped working after 5 months. I see in the reviews that this is not just me. I understand that there is a warranty so I'll have to figure out how to access that. Fun is. Update - I followed the instructions on the site to take advantage of the warranty and they responded quickly with an offer to replace this with a newer model. I mailed it back to them yesterday and we'll see how it goes from here but great so far!
customer_reviews.author: Marshall St. Clair

customer_reviews.title: Love these headphones
customer_reviews.text: Love these headphones. I use them daily at work. They fit well in my ear. If I have both buds in, it blocks out 80% of the background noise. So fair warning, if someone needs to get your attention they might start jumping up and down in front of you or sneak up behind trying to scare you.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Good but not...
customer_reviews.text: I forgot to write a review for these so I figured I'd do it now. These were amazing earbuds but after I started going to the gym (about two months in) the sound quality dropped. A week later it completely died.
customer_reviews.author: Matty

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting
customer_reviews.text: These are the only earbuds I have bought that have lasted. Some part always stops working in the first 2-3 months.. These work perfectly and I've been using them everyday for almost a year. I am buying a second pair in my favorite color.
customer_reviews.author: jj

customer_reviews.title: far better than any of the inexpensive earbuds that came packaged ...
customer_reviews.text: No one ever accused me of being an audiophile, but these sound extremely crisp and clear, far better than any of the inexpensive earbuds that came packaged with various devices we own. Remember that this is the Apple version. They sound fine but the buttons won't work with an android device.
customer_reviews.author: Russ in Elk Grove

customer_reviews.title: sound quality just OK
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with the sound quality of these headphones. They fit nicely and the noise reduction is great, but I feel like the sound lacks bass and clarity. I guess the value is the weather resistance with these headphones but if you're looking for excellent sound as I was, I would recommend a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Kermit

product_meta.title: Klipsch Image S4i Rugged - ORANGE All Weather In-Ear Headphones
product_meta.description:
Color:Orange| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingThe new Image S4i Rugged Headphones utilize tough rubber moldings and an all-weather design to protect the legendary Klipsch sound from Mother Nature’s bad side. Neither rain, sleet, snow, nor concrete jungle can stop the award winning acoustics and live music experience of the Image S4i Rugged headphones. An extra-large, 3-button remote lets you precisely control iPhone calls and music whether you’re wearing bulky gloves or are simply on the go. And while the headphones’ exterior is built tough, these in-ear headphones have patented oval ear tips to keep you comfortable. Rock the Klipsch Image S4i Rugged ear buds in yellow, orange, blue or red.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


KLIPSCH IMAGE S4I RUGGED ORANGE IN-EAR HEADPHONES
The Image S4i Rugged Headphones utilize tough rubber moldings and an all-weather design to protect the legendary Klipsch sound from Mother Nature’s bad side. Neither rain, sleet, snow, nor concrete jungle can stop the award winning acoustics and live music experience of the Image S4i Rugged headphones. An extra-large, 3-button remote lets you precisely control iPhone calls and music whether you’re wearing bulky gloves or are simply on the go. And while the headphones’ exterior is built tough, these in-ear headphones have patented oval ear tips to keep you comfortable. Rock the Klipsch Image S4i Rugged headphones in yellow, orange, blue or red.

Born in a Tin Shed to Rock the House
At the heart of every Klipsch product is over 66 years of audio expertise beating strong. Our commitment to no-compromise performance has made us the preferred choice of top cinema operators, a leader in stereo and home theater sound and a premium name in headphones. Meticulously researched and designed in Indianapolis, Indiana, these headphones personify the no-BS attitude of the company’s founder, Paul W. Klipsch.

Long May You Rock
Whether you are navigating the slopes, running through the park, or hitting the gym, the Image S4i Rugged will be up to the task with its moisture-resistant design, allowing you to take on the mountain, tackle the ramp, and handle the challenges of Mother Nature without worrying about your headphone. 

Armed with one of the best warranty programs in the industry, with a 2-year replacement policy on all headphone products as opposed to the 1-year offered by many competitors, you can take comfort that your Klipsch headphones will keep the music going as long as you do. 

A Concert in Your Cranium
When it comes to comfort, no one beats Klipsch headphones. Unlike circular-shaped ear tips that put stress on the pressure points inside the ear, Klipsch’s exclusive oval ear tips naturally fit the contours of your ear canals, providing comfortable long-term wear. In addition to unequaled comfort, these exclusive ear tips create a perfect acoustic seal to produce renowned, high-performance Klipsch sound. These light-weight ear tips also offer superior noise isolation, blocking out almost all ambient noise and provide excellent bass. Because we want you to be rocking out to your favorite tunes for a long, long time, the seal also allows you to enjoy your music at lower, safer volumes. 

Listen without Limits
The Image S4i Rugged’s audio works with virtually any device that has a standard 3.5mm headphone jack and features an Apple-based mic and three-button remote for taking calls and controlling music on iPods, iPhones or iPads. Located on the back of the remote is a directional mic for hands-free, crystal clear phone calls. 

Built for all sorts of extreme activities, the S4i Rugged’s oversized remote allows you to control your music and phone calls without having to remove your bulky gloves or take a break from the action. And with its positioning at the cable yoke, the S4i Rugged’s mic and remote are exactly where you want and need them when answering calls and controlling music. The improved microphone is a highly intelligible 360° design with echo cancellation, so you can make and receive phone calls with crystal-clear audio and won’t have to worry about all of the noise around you.

Your favorite playlists are at your fingertips with the S4i Rugged. The plus and minus buttons control volume up and down, while the middle button does the rest of the work. You can use the middle button to take advantage of the iPhone 3GS, iPhone 4, iPhone 4S, iPhone 5 and iPad’s voice control feature. Just hold down the button and say your command.

Front Row Center. Anywhere.


Just like a VIP at a concert, you get a bevy of extras with the Image S4i Rugged headphone including four pairs of different-sized patented oval ear tips, clothing clip and a protective carrying case. Available in yellow, orange, blue or red, the S4i Rugged also includes a 2-year warranty so you can rest assured that your Klipsch headphones will provide years of listening enjoyment.
feature_bullets: All weather design resists moisture and functions thru extreme elements
Same award winning acoustics as the Image S4
X-large 3-button remote for easy control during outdoor activity
Directional mic for hands-free, crystal clear phone calls

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars999 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
